text: They are obviously using the simplified mafia rules, but I sort of wish they actually built the village from the browser game and forced the players to learn the entire esoteric Town of Salem rulebook with town roles, jesters and arsonists, last wills, etc.
There's a new Bulgarian reality TV show based on the mafia party game and my buddy that I used to play a shitton of Town of Salem with before school every day is really into it.
If you find yourself in a room where all four walls have a window on them, it means you are at the top of a tower...

Forgot who said it, but one insidious thing school does is instill you with a subconscious belief that progress is only possible in your private free time (you study for tests and do homework alone late at night) while in the real world you often "make progress" during work hours

You can understand and learn to do stuff in real time as you actually do it, but if you have school brain it will seem impossible and you will think you have to just take mental notes and study everything on your own at home
